name: Braised Pork With Red Wine
description: This easy recipe can be made in a saucepan, Dutch oven or slow cooker. The long simmer gives the pork shoulder, an inexpensive but versatile cut, a chance to absorb the robust flavors of red wine, carrot and garlic that it’s cooked alongside. Serve it over egg noodles and topped with parsley for a hearty, satisfying dinner.
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds boneless pork shoulder, cut into large chunks
2 cups fruity red wine, like Beaujolais or Burgundy (pinot noir)
1 pound fat carrots, peeled and cut into large chunks
10 cloves garlic, more or less, peeled
Chopped fresh parsley leaves for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Combine pork, salt and pepper to taste, wine, stock, carrots and garlic in a saucepan, Dutch oven or slow cooker. Bring to a boil, then adjust heat so that mixture simmers steadily but not vigorously. (If using a slow cooker, just turn it to ''high'' and let cook for at least three hours.)

Cook, stirring every half-hour or so, until meat is very tender and just about falling apart, at least an hour and most likely a bit longer. Use a slotted spoon to remove solid ingredients to a bowl, then turn heat to high. (If using a slow cooker, transfer liquid to a saucepan for this step.) Reduce to about a cup, or even less. Taste and adjust seasoning, then lower heat and stir in butter.
Add solids to sauce and reheat. Serve over egg noodles, garnished with parsley.
